text:
Hi, I am an R user, new to julia. I am trying to re-write an R function in julia. The syntax seems to be fine, but I am getting
```TypeError: non-boolean (Missing) used in boolean context```
I posted on stackoverflow (<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66751486/error-when-assigning-a-difference-to-a-vector-in-julia>) but didn't get any reply so far. I would really appreciate if you guide me what I'm doing wrong.

attachments.title: Error when assigning a difference to a vector in julia
attachments.text: Goal I have a working R function that uses a for-loop. To take advantage of julia's speed, I am re-writing the R function julia. R function apply_wiedemann <- function(data, ...
attachments.fallback: Stack Overflow: Error when assigning a difference to a vector in julia
